title: Enforcement of decrees; bailiff
context: §501-64 Enforcement of decrees; bailiff. The court, in all matters over which it has jurisdiction, may enforce its orders or decrees in the same manner as decrees are enforced in actions in the nature of suits in equity, and upon the request of the judge, the chief of police shall assign an officer to attend the sittings of the court. [L 1903, c 56, §17; am L 1913, c 21, §1; RL 1925, §3206; RL 1935, §5036; RL 1945, §12636; RL 1955, §342-37; HRS §501-64; am L 1972, c 91, §1(n)]
